::CyberShark::

    "I don't know why he's abandoning the base," CyberShark=
 said. "He sent a message and said that I was to go to the Mountain base, a=
nd that I should contact them when I was ready to go."
  ----- Original Mes=
sage ----- 
  From: logomorph@... 
  To: nbwrpg@egroups.com 
  Sent=
: Wednesday, August 30, 2000 7:03 AM
  Subject: Re: Abandoning the embassy
=



       
       My Groups | nbwrpg Main Page | Start a new group!  


  :=
:Battera::

  She looked at Iron Raptor and nodded, "Excuse me for a moment=
,"  she 
  walked out of the room and went into the hallway. She opened her=
 
  link."What? Abandoning the base?  Are we still hosting the peace 
  tal=
ks?  What happened? What's going on? Oh, please tell me, what 
  happened t=
o make Vulois abandon the base like this.  I was just about 
  to talk to t=
he maximal leader."

  She was suddenly feeling scared.  She had tried her =
best to complete 
  her mission and jsut as she was about to, they abandon =
everything.
  She felt her face loose color and her spark drop to her feet.=
  She 
  leaned back against a wall and slid down into a sitting position. =

  She was still in shock.  "Why now?" she whispered to herself.


  --- In=
 nbwrpg@egroups.com, "David Torrey" <Dachande85@m...> wrote:
  > ::CyberSha=
rk::
  > 
  >     He received the message and stopped in his tracks. What s=
hould 
  he do? Should he continue to the Destron base? Or go back and wait=
 of 
  orders?
  >     "Vulois, there was no luck with the Predacons, I am =
going to 
  the Destron base," CyberShark said. "I will accompany Battera o=
n her 
  way up."
  >     "Battera, it's me, CyberShark," He said on anothe=
r 
  frequency. "The Embassy is moving, as I'm sure you've heard. Comm me 
=
  once your ready to leave, I'll join you."
